Detailed Description

MIDI File Parser and Player
Author:
Phil Burk, Copyright 2002 Mobileer, PROPRIETARY and CONFIDENTIAL

Define Documentation

#define MIDIFILEPLAYER_DEFAULT_TEMPO_SCALER   (0x00010000)

The tempo scaler value that corresponds to playing a song at its original rate.

See MIDIFilePlayer_SetTempoScaler().

Typedef Documentation

typedef void* MIDIFilePlayer

Opaque data type representing an internal MIDI File player structure.

typedef void( MIDIFilePlayer_ResetCallback)(void *userContext)

Define function to reset MIDI Synth context.

typedef void( MIDIFilePlayer_TextCallback)(int trackIndex, int metaEventType, const char *addr, int numChars, void *userData)

Define function to receive text MetaEvents such as lyrics, etc.

typedef void( MIDIFilePlayer_WriteCallback)(void *userContext, int byte)

Define function to receive regular MIDI bytes from SMF.

int MIDIFile_Print ( unsigned char *  image,
int  numBytes 
)

Print the contents of a MIDI File image in memory.

SPMIDI_Error MIDIFilePlayer_Create ( MIDIFilePlayer **  playerPtr,
int  sampleRate,
const unsigned char *  image,
int  numBytes 
)

Setup a player for a MIDI file image.

The parser will make an initial pass over the file to find the start of each track. It then assigns a track player to each track. Note that as of V1.80 you must call SPMIDI_Initialize() before calling this function.

Delete the MIDI file player data.

int MIDIFilePlayer_GetTrackEnable ( MIDIFilePlayer *  player,
int  trackIndex 
)

Return enable status for a track.

Parameters:
trackIndex Index of the track starting with zero. In a format 1 MIDI file, track zero is typically the tempo track.
Returns:
onOrOff Zero if track is disabled, 1 if enabled, or negative on error.

int MIDIFilePlayer_GoToFrame ( MIDIFilePlayer *  playerExt,
SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
int  desiredFrame 
)

Reposition cursor in MIDI file to given frame.

All MIDI events except noteOns will be processed so the MIDI state should be correct. If the desiredFrame is before the current frame then the song will be rewound to the beginning and played forward.

int MIDIFilePlayer_PlayFrames ( MIDIFilePlayer *  player,
SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
int  numFrames 
)

Advance the track players forward in the file by a time corresponding to the given number of audio frames.

Returns:
0 if more events are available to play. 1 if finished.

SPMIDI_Error MIDIFilePlayer_Rewind ( MIDIFilePlayer *  player  ) 

void MIDIFilePlayer_SetSynthCallbacks ( MIDIFilePlayer *  playerExt,
MIDIFilePlayer_WriteCallback *  writeCallback,
MIDIFilePlayer_ResetCallback *  resetCallback 
)

Set function to be called when MIDI bytes are to be played.

SPMIDI_Error MIDIFilePlayer_SetTempoScaler ( MIDIFilePlayer *  player,
int  tempoScaler 
)

Adjust the tempo of a song.

If you set it to MIDIFILEPLAYER_DEFAULT_TEMPO_SCALER then it will play back at its original tempo. Passing a larger or smaller value will cause the song to play faster or slower by a proportional amount.

Parameters:
tempoScaler Adjust the tempo by this 16.16 fixed point fraction.

void MIDIFilePlayer_SetTextCallback ( MIDIFilePlayer *  player,
MIDIFilePlayer_TextCallback *  textCallback,
void *  userData 
)

Set function to be called when a text MetaEvent is encountered while playing.

SPMIDI_Error MIDIFilePlayer_SetTrackEnable ( MIDIFilePlayer *  player,
int  trackIndex,
int  onOrOff 
)

Enable or disable NoteOn events on a track.

NoteOff events will still be played to prevent stuck notes. All other events will be played as well to maintain the state of track.

Parameters:
trackIndex Index of the track starting with zero. In a format 1 MIDI file, track zero is typically the tempo track.
onOrOff Zero to disable a track, non-zero to enable a track.
